text: Hemerocallis hakuunensis, known as Baekunsan daylily, is a species in the family Asphodelaceae, native to Korea. Its Korean name is Baegunsan wonchuri (). Baegunsan () is the name of several mountains. The word wonchuri () refers to a variety of daylily species in Korean, and H. hakuunensis is the most commonly encountered and gastronomically consumed daylily species in Korea. ==References== hakuunensis Category:Plants described in 1943
title: Hemerocallis hakuunensis
